column1: Cyproheptadine is a type of drug called an antihistamine.
These drugs are used to relieve allergy symptoms.
Cyproheptadine is found in medicines with these names: - Klarivitina - Nuran - Periactin Other medicines may also contain cyproheptadine.

BLADDER AND KIDNEYS - Inability to urinate EYES, EARS, NOSE, MOUTH, AND THROAT - Blurred vision - Dry mouth - Enlarged pupils - Very dry eyes - Ringing in the ears HEART AND BLOOD VESSELS - Low blood pressure - Pounding heartbeat - Rapid heartbeat NERVOUS SYSTEM - Agitation - Confusion - Convulsions (seizures) - Delirium - Depression - Drowsiness - Hallucinations - Increased sleepiness - Nervousness - Seizures - Tremor - Unsteadiness
